margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hydT7GgM02c/U18chH5EdeI/AAAAAAAArwo/LEaERUbQmJU/s1600/Page+10+Cu65ehakra.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The potential of all\npsychic energies resides coiled up as the Kundalini in the Muladhara and is\nraised through sustained yogic self effort. &nbsp;This is by an upward ascent of the energies\nthrough the successive Chakras through a central channel called the Sushumna\nwhich is normally closed, but can be opened by special yogic effort. &nbsp;Two supplementary channels called the Ida and\nPingala along side the Sushumna run along the spinal column and are normally\nopen and serve the flow of the normal energies sustaining life\u2019s normal\nactivities. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bsWzRjbGx-o/U2CyY7okHcI/AAAAAAAAr2k/RY9G2r6XvGk/s1600/suskuvkthumna_2998.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bsWzRjbGx-o/U2CyY7okHcI/AAAAAAAAr2k/RY9G2r6XvGk/s1600/suskuvkthumna_2998.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the energies rising\nthrough the successive Chakras along the Sushumna reach the Sahasrara, the\nindividual merges in the highest Consciousness level of the Divine. Kundalini\nis connected with the nervous and endocrinal systems of the body and a linkage\nwith the physical, mental, emotional, psychological and spiritual components of\nthe human personality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the type of\nparanoia which made Vatican burn all their Templar Crusader Knights ( Catholic\nheroes really ) on the stake -- for they were caught doing Kundalini raising,\nMudra, Tantra , Chakra cleansing Reiki ,, chanting Mantras and worshipping\nShiva Lingam black meteorite stones and Narasimha avatar of Lord Vishnu... .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">SECRET EXCAVATIONS AT\nJERUSALEM BY TEMPLAR KNIGHTS VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound vibrations are\nintimately connected to our \u201cprana\u201d or \u201clife energy. &nbsp;While Physics has gone beyond the atom to the\nsub-atomic NANO world, biology foolishly has stopped at the molecular world where\nthe protein chemistry of life\u2019s activities is rooted. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If modern medicine has to progress they must\nconsider that we are electrically charged and sound bathed cellular creatures. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 7000 year old Vishnu\nPurana, states that \u201cThe Spirit Is Clothed With Sound\u201d.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cosmic creative\nvibration ( sphota ) arises between Shiva and Shakti called Nada. &nbsp;This Nada then gets consolidated into Shabda\nBrahman (differentiated sound energy), the universal cosmic resonance,\nsymbolized by OM. &nbsp;From this arises\ncosmic intelligence that is responsible for the creation.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two types of\nnada.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first is ahata nada, which is\nstruck sound, sound that is produced, sound that gives an immediate &nbsp;impact, sound of all kinds whether a human\nbeing can hear it or not.&nbsp; &nbsp;This, of course, is the same as the western\nunderstanding of sound as always coming from movement, from something having\nbeen struck, either the wind through the vocal cords or through a reed, or the\npercussive sound of the plucking of strings or the beating of a drum membrane.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">External music is\nconveyed to consciousness via the ears, in which mechanical energy is converted\nto electrochemical energy and then transformed in the brain to sensations of\nsound</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But according to the\nancient wisdom of Indian philosophy there is yet another type of sound which is\nthe source of the first, anahata nada, cosmic sound. &nbsp;This is sound that is potential, thought but\nnot expressed.&nbsp; &nbsp;This cosmic sound is perceptible only to the 12\nstrand DNA Maharishi -- the unstruck sound which vibrates in space without a\ncause, the sound that is produced from the ether.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The anahata nada&nbsp; is also the sound of devotion and\nconcentration, the sound that the yogi hears in deep meditation whose function\nis to liberate the soul. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inner sound is sacred\nand once reached will open the practitioner's chakras, which ultimately will\nunite the body to the divine. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inner music owes\nits reception to the subtle heart chakra, also known as anahata chakra, which\nis not a sensory organ.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music is a painting on\nthe canvas of silence. If every sound on this cosmos and planet earth were\nsimultaneously recorded, there would be only one single sound OM.&nbsp;&nbsp; Nada is not a part of dhvani (external\nsound). &nbsp;Rather dhvani instead arises as\na projection of nada.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we invoke sound, &nbsp;we also invoke the trinity gods of Lords &nbsp;Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva, because they are\nnothing other than a scalar fields who are personalised.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything that exists\ncan be reduced to two concepts: consciousness and manifestations.\nManifestations are dependent on consciousness. In Tantra, consciousness is\ncalled Shiva, and manifestation, which is also seen as power, is called Shakti.\n&nbsp;In BrahmAn, Shakti only exists as a\npotential. . Shiva as an observer is called Para Shiva and the observed is\ncalled Para Shakti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sankhya-Yoga system\ndivides all knowable phenomena into 25 Tattvas. &nbsp;&nbsp;Tattva is a Sanskrit and Malayalam word\nmeaning&nbsp; 'principle', 'reality' .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">25. Purusha \u2013 the\nsentient being (consciousness), the experiencer</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24. Prakriti \u2013 primal\nnature (root of all insentient matter)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antahkaranas \u2013 internal\norgans<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">23. Mahat-Buddhi \u2013\nintelligence<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22. Ahamkara \u2013\nobjective ego<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">21. Manas \u2013 mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Jnanendriyas Sense-organs, for receiving the\nbhutas and the tanmatras, viz<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">20&nbsp; karna (the auditory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19&nbsp; tvak (the thermal sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18&nbsp; chaksu (the visual sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">17&nbsp; rasana (the gustatory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16&nbsp; nasa (the olfactory sense)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmaendriyas organs of\naction, viz.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15 vak (vocal\norgan)&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14 pani (manual\norgan)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13 pada (organ of\nlocomotion)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12 payu (excretory\norgan)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11 upastha (genital\norgan)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tanmatras \u2013 subtle\nelements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10. Shabda \u2013 sound<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Sparsha \u2013 feel<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Rupa \u2013 form<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Rasa \u2013 taste<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Gandha \u2013 smell<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahabhutas \u2013 gross\nelements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Akasha \u2013 space<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Vayu \u2013 air<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Tejas \u2013 fire<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Ap \u2013 water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Prithivi \u2013 earth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>SANKHYA PHILOSOPHY OF\nHINDUISM , EPISTEMOLOGY OF SANATANA DHARMA VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Millions of words have\nbeen written about Sankhya philosophy in books and the internet\u2014all BULL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you utter beeja\nmantras, you resonate with the energy of the associated chakra.-- as mentioned\nin the&nbsp; Jabala Darsana Upanishad in 5000\nBC.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham, Yam, Ram, Vam and\nLam are the panch bhoota mantras.&nbsp; &nbsp;The five elements evolve from the five\ntanamatras (principals); earth from gandha (smell), water from rasa (taste),\nfire from rupa (sight), air from sparsha (touch) and akasha from shabda\n(hearing).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Every Beej mantra\ncreates a huMMMMMMMM, which produces the magic molecule Nitric Oxide.</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric\noxide is a gas that affects blood vessels.&nbsp;\nIt is a simple molecule, having two atoms - nitrogen and oxygen.&nbsp; But it does an incredible array of things.&nbsp; Our blood vessels make nitric oxide. It's a\npotent and facile dilator.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the human body reaches the age of 27 years, the\nsecretion of nitric oxide is at its peak. As you get&nbsp; older and the production of nitric oxide in\nthe human body declines gradually, more from age 42 onwards.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide\ncontrols blood flow in our body.&nbsp; It\ncontrols our vascular resistance , the blood pressure . When your body produces\nsufficient amounts of Nitric oxide, then your blood vessels are relaxed, and\nyour blood pressure is low.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conversely if you're\nnot making enough or Nitric Oxide production is inactivated,&nbsp; then&nbsp;\nyour blood vessels become contracted and your blood pressure shoots up.&nbsp; So this is an important feature of the blood\nvessels is its&nbsp; ability to control its\nown diameter automatically.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is part of the body's self-defense\nmechanism.It can defend against bacteria.&nbsp;\nIt also defends against tumor cells.&nbsp;\nNitric Oxide in higher concentrations can actually halt the growth of\ncells or can halt bacterial growth, so it's a defense against infection.\nMacrophages, certain cells of the immune system, produce Nitric oxide in order\nto kill invading bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a defense against\ntumor and cancer. It is a defense against hardening of the arteries too.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nitric\noxide - is our self-defense system against athrosclerosis.&nbsp; The endothelial lining of the blood vessel is\nlike Teflon.&nbsp; It keeps things from\nsticking to the vessel wall.&nbsp; The reason\nit has this property of Teflon is because it releases nitric oxide, so it's a\nnon-sticky surface because it's releasing nitric oxide, which not only relaxes\nthe blood vessel but also prevents things from sticking to the vessel.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide also serves as a\nneurotransmitter between nerve cells, part of its general role in redox\nsignaling. Unlike most other neurotransmitters that only transmit information\nfrom a presynaptic to a postsynaptic neuron, the small, uncharged, and\nfat-soluble nitric oxide molecule can diffuse widely and readily enters cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is an\nimportant neurotransmitter in various parts of the gastrointestinal tract. It\ncauses relaxation of the gastrointestinal smooth muscle. In the stomach it\nincreases the capacity of the fundus to store food and fluids. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide acts on\ncardiac muscle to decrease contractility and heart rate. Nitric oxide\ncontributes to the regulation of cardiac contractility.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/aCocQa2Bcuc/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/aCocQa2Bcuc&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/aCocQa2Bcuc&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dissonant sounds create\ndisharmony -- rifts between the individual and her environment, as well as\nwithin the body's own frequencies. &nbsp;If 10\ntuning forks tuned to the same frequency are lined up together and one is\nstruck, they will all begin to reverberate together. &nbsp;This is resonance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, if you strike\na tuning fork of a different frequency and place it near the others, they will\nall stop. This is dissonance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kolam is an Indian art\nform of drawing designs with rice flour.&nbsp;\nKolam is seen adorning the doorsteps of every traditional Hindu home in\nsouthern India.&nbsp; They are drawn&nbsp; around a grid of 108 dots , which serve as\nthe skeletal structure for the kolam. .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px;\">\n<div style=\"font-style: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">n-gram models are used in statistical natural language processing, in speech recognition, handwriting recognition , information retrieval, optical character recognition &nbsp;etc.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">n-grams find use in several areas of computer science, computational linguistics, and applied mathematics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-style: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-style: normal; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astadhyayi, presented\nthe processes of phonology, morphology and syntax, and laid down the basis for\ncenturies of commentaries and expositions by Sanskrit grammarians who followed.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-style: normal; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's approach was\namazingly formal; his production rules for deriving complex structures and\nsentences represent resemble those of modern computer languages. &nbsp;Many of the developments in Indian\nMathematics, especially the place value notation system may have originated\nfrom Paninian analysis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-style: normal; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-style: normal; line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's grammar\nconsists of four parts:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u015aivas\u016btra: phonology\n(notations for phonemes specified in 14 lines) <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A\u1e63\u1e6dadhy\u0101y\u012b: morphology\n(construction rules for complexes) <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dh\u0101tup\u0101\u1e6dha: list of\nroots (classes of verbal roots)</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ga\u1e47ap\u0101\u1e6dha: lists\nclasses of primitive nominal stems</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Shiva Sutras,\nPanini discusses something like the concepts of the phoneme, the morpheme and\nthe root.&nbsp; The Shiva Sutras describe a\nphonemic notational system in the opening part of the Astadhyayi.&nbsp;&nbsp; The notational system introduces different\nclusters of phonemes that serve special roles in the morphology of Sanskrit,\nand are referred to throughout the text.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/xmXtCp9uupo/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/xmXtCp9uupo&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/xmXtCp9uupo&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanayana ceremony,\nor Vedic initiation of boys, is known as Brahmopadesa, &nbsp;or the teaching of BrahmAn. &nbsp;&nbsp;The Gayathri\nmantra is the mantra selected for Brahmopadesa. The boy's father becomes his\nGURU and whispers into his ears this powerful Gayatri mantra.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sacred Thread\nCeremony signifies a young brahmin boy's formal entrance into the first stage\nof life as a student\u2014a ritual telling him that he is now come to age ( to learn\nthe holy Vedas..)</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><i style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Below video : Correct&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">pronunciation</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/zxa7Z6NCgqg/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/zxa7Z6NCgqg&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/zxa7Z6NCgqg&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In terms of the\nuniversal cosmology, vaikhari, madhyama and pashyanti correspond respectively\nto bhuh, bhuvah, and svah.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gayathri Mantra is in\nconsonance with the spirit of the Vedas. &nbsp;This Mantra originates in the 7000 year olf\nRig&nbsp; Veda (III-62.10) &nbsp;and is referred to with great reverence in the\nUpanishads and many other works.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigveda stated 7000\nyear ago that speech process has four stages. These four stages are Para,\nPasyanti, Madhyama and Vaikhari.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GG3mhOnvAS0/U1_PozcYZmI/AAAAAAAAryU/1mquASy309Y/s1600/ddees1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GG3mhOnvAS0/U1_PozcYZmI/AAAAAAAAryU/1mquASy309Y/s1600/ddees1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda brahmAn manifests\nthrough his power of maya first as para vani in the mooladhara chakra at the\nperineum, then as pashyanti in the manipura chakra at the navel, next as\nmadhyama in the heart and then eventually as vaikhari in the throat and mouth.\nThis is the divine descent of voice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first three are\ninternal and yogic and can be experienced only by seers. The fourth stage is\nVaikhari is the audible speech, which is used by all human beings.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general perception of a layman is that when we speak, sound comes from the throat. &nbsp;But what happens is when we have the urge or the thought to speak, our life force in the form of\nvaayu, starts from the root chakra and brings Paraa, the subtle sound, then\ntravels up to the navel, heart chakras as Pasyanti and Madhyamaa respectively,\nthen comes to the throat, mouth, teeth and tongue as Vaikhari to come out as\nspeech or sound at the gross level. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four levels of\nsound correspond to four states of consciousness. Paraa represents the\ntranscendental consciousness. Pasyanti represents the intellectual\nconsciousness. Madhyamaa represents the mental consciousness. And Vaikhari\nrepresents the physical consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zNKGsIP7JGo/U1_PMmN3K5I/AAAAAAAAryM/I9WQpCq3IZU/s1600/imagsssesCAWL6LND.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zNKGsIP7JGo/U1_PMmN3K5I/AAAAAAAAryM/I9WQpCq3IZU/s1600/imagsssesCAWL6LND.jpg\" width=\"309\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These states of consciousness correspond\nwith the four states known technically as Jagrat, Svapna, Sushupti, and Turiya\n- or the wakeful state, the dreaming state, the dreamless state, and the\ntranscendental state.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four stages also\ncorrespond to the four types of bodies. The Sthula sharira, ( physical body)\noperates in the state of Jagrat (wakeful state). &nbsp;It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Vaikhari-vaak is manifested. The Sukshma-sharira, (\nsubtle or psychic body ) operates in the state of Svapna. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Madhyama-vaak is manifested. &nbsp;The Kaarana-sharira, ( causal body ) ,\noperates in the state of Sushupti ( deep sleep ). &nbsp;It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Pashyanti-vaak is manifested. The Para-vaak is\nmanifested through the fourth state of consciousness, known as Turiya.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1V9YUW1VlyQ/U1_U4d4BwYI/AAAAAAAAryk/iU1M5EmGq_w/s1600/Vedic_sound_table-cdage.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"184\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1V9YUW1VlyQ/U1_U4d4BwYI/AAAAAAAAryk/iU1M5EmGq_w/s1600/Vedic_sound_table-cdage.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PL_85RL9KiQ/U1_XP748hOI/AAAAAAAAryw/dE64L-eDsHA/s1600/try-cocoongg-i-2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PL_85RL9KiQ/U1_XP748hOI/AAAAAAAAryw/dE64L-eDsHA/s1600/try-cocoongg-i-2.jpg\" width=\"518\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WHAT IS PARA ?</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para represents transcendental\nconsciousness. Para is a soundless seed, &nbsp;&nbsp;pure adya\nshakti from kundalini, beyond name and forms. &nbsp;. Para is Adya Shakti. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Taitreeya Upanishad,\nAakaasa evolved first. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">From Aakaasa evolved Vaayu, from Vayu evolved Agni, from\nAgni evolved Jala and from Jala evolved Prithvi. &nbsp;So Aakaasa is called Param, as it was the\nfirst one to form among the five basic elements. Its attribute Sabda is called\nParaa.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the time of\ncreation, this Paraa expressed itself as Bindu or a subtle particle. It is also\ncalled as Kaarana bindu, the cause for all sound manifestations within and\noutside our body. Paraa means the highest or the farthest. &nbsp;&nbsp;Para vaak is the sound beyond the perception\nof our senses. Paraa is the first stage of sound in its unmanifest stage and is\nthe source of all root ideas and germ thoughts. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of Para-vaak there is no\ndistinction between the object and the sound. The sound contains within it all\nthe qualities of the object. &nbsp;Nada Yogis claim that Paraa Nada is a high\nfrequency sound, so high that it does not stir or produce any vibrations. &nbsp;By\nthe urge of man to talk, with the help of vaayu or air, Paraa moves up to the\nManipuraka chakra or the navel centre and gets transformed into Pasyanti.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para means highest or farthest, and in this connection it\nindicates that sound which is beyond the perception of the senses. Para-vak is\nalso known as \"rava-shabda\" - an unvibratory condition of sound\nbeyond the reach of mind and intelligence (avyakta), only to be realized by\ngreat souls, the 12 strand maharishis, parama-jnanis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of para-vak\nthere is no distinction between the object and the sound. The sound contains\nwithin it all the qualities of the object. The highest manifestation of sound\nenergy, the primal voice, the divine voice is para. The para voice gives birth\nto root ideas or germ thoughts. It is the first manifestation of voice. In the\npara state the sound remains in an undifferentiated form. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para is pure intention.&nbsp; Pure because it is a direct expression of the\nwill of reality, unadulterated by any personal preference. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para means transcendental,\n\u2018beyond\u2019 or \u2018the other side\u2019. It is beyond the reach of the indriyas, or sense\norgans, and the mind and other means of cognition.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence para nada is the\ntranscendental sound. It is indicative of a truth that there is a sphere of\nsuper-consciousness where the sound is heard in different dimensions.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sounds having a very\nhigh frequency are transformed into silence. Beyond a certain limit, the ears\ndo not have the capacity. No one can hear or understand a sound like that even\nif it is present. Para or transcendental sound has the highest vibration\nfrequency.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This intense vibration faculty makes para inaudible. . When a sound\ngoes to its maximum pitch, it attains a sudden stillness, and that is para\nnada.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_H5pjGnGtfo/U1_beAn4jNI/AAAAAAAAry8/wjcVjqYKX8c/s1600/3TTT1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_H5pjGnGtfo/U1_beAn4jNI/AAAAAAAAry8/wjcVjqYKX8c/s1600/3TTT1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px;\">WHAT IS PASYANTI ?</b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti represents the\nintellectual consciousness, a state of abstract knowledge, like an idea which\nhas not yet been expressed in words. &nbsp;Pashyanti\nis the thought form. Pasyanti literally means observing or seeing one's self.\nIn the pasyanti stage sound possesses qualities such as color and form. &nbsp;When sound goes up to the navel with the\nbodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable (varna), yet\nconnected with the mind, it is known as Pashyanti-vaak.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti observes and\nanalyses her impending changes in the heart, throat and the tongue, where the\nsound finally attains audibility. Within the Pasyanti-vaak exists the nature's\nIccha-shakti, or the power of will.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pashyanti-vak\nis the second level of sound, and is less subtle than para-vak. Pashyanti in\nSanskrit means \"that which can be seen or visualized\".</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CaaBpXB2t2A/U2DLjLpak8I/AAAAAAAAr3E/AOtOvdwVPS4/s1600/1194254113_pavvshyanti.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"273\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-CaaBpXB2t2A/U2DLjLpak8I/AAAAAAAAr3E/AOtOvdwVPS4/s1600/1194254113_pavvshyanti.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yogis who have inner\nvision can perceive these qualities in sound. &nbsp;On this stage the differences between language\ndo not exist, as this sound is intuitive and situated beyond rigidly defined\nconcepts. &nbsp;On the stage of pashyanti-vak,\nspeech is intuitively connected to the object. There is near oneness between\nthe word and the experience described. &nbsp;Pashyanti-vak\nis the finest impulse of speech. The seat of pashyanti is in the navel or the\nManipura Chakra.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sound goes up to\nthe naval with the bodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable\n(varna), yet connected with the mind, it is pashyanti-vak. Within the\npashyanti-vak exists the nature's iccha-shakti, or the power of will.&nbsp; Yogis who have subtle inner vision can\nexperience the pashyanti state of sound.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pashyanti does not\ndistinguish between subject and object. Perceptible but not yet particularized,\nit covers the middle ground between para\u2019s pure intention and madhyama\u2019s\nverbalized but as yet unspoken mental speech. The second stage of sound, which\nhas less frequency and is more gross than para, is pashyanti. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a sound which cannot be heard, but it\ncan be seen. This is why Pashyanti in Sanskrit means \u2018that which can be seen or\nvisualized\u2019.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-agOXm3-lEJM/U2DQToT-VHI/AAAAAAAAr5I/DhOu4gy_RbA/s1600/imagrryes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-agOXm3-lEJM/U2DQToT-VHI/AAAAAAAAr5I/DhOu4gy_RbA/s1600/imagrryes.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px;\">WHAT IS MADHYAMA &nbsp;?</b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyamaa represents\nthe mental consciousness&nbsp; . Pasyanti, on\nreaching the Anaahata chakra or the heart chakra , transforms into Madhyama\nvaak. &nbsp;Madhyamaa literally means in\nbetween or middle. &nbsp;Here there is a clear\ndistinction between the sound and the object it denotes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama vaak is more\nof a mental speech rather than the external audible speech. &nbsp;Within the Madhyama-vaak exists the nature's\nJnana-shakti, or the power of knowledge. &nbsp;Madhyama-vak is the intermediate unexpressed\nstate of sound, whose seat is in the heart.. The middle sound is that sound\nwhich exists between the states of susupti and jagrat. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is the\nintermediate unexpressed state of sound experienced in the heart. Madhyama is\nmental speech, verbalized but unspoken, the internal monologue and dialogue; it\nexpresses j\u00f1ana shakti, the power of knowledge and wisdom (or lack thereof). &nbsp;Madhyama measures, evaluates, questions,\nharnessing your rational and emotional minds to formulate the intentions that\nprecipitate into words. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is\nparticularized into phonemes, directed to mental objects, the objects of the\ninner senses. It straddles the gulf between the noiseless conviction that is\npashyanti and the spoken word that is vaikhari.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is sound\nhaving lower frequencies than para and pashyanti, but still subtler than the\naudible vaikhari form of sound. &nbsp;No\naudible effect is produced in it. Madhyama produces very minute vibrations in\nthe act of a whisper. In an ordinary sound, two objects strike against each\nother in order to produce sound. &nbsp;But in\nmadhyama no two things strike violently so as to produce audible sound. &nbsp;The word madhyama means a middle sound, a\nwhispering sound or the sound of a whisper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px;\">WHAT IS VAIKHARI ?</b></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari represents the\nphysical consciousness, an audible speech manifestation .. Vaikhari resides in the\nthroat chakra. &nbsp;Vaikhari is what we speak\nthrough our mouth, which had started from Para. &nbsp;Para is subtle and Vaikhari is manifested form\nof Bhava/sound. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari is the &nbsp;sound which has come all the way from the root\nchakra with the force of vaayu, travels further upwards to the throat, mouth,\nteeth and tongue, to become an articulate sound, audible to the external ear.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sabda is spoken\nthrough the mouth with the help of syllables, that speech is Vaikhari vak. Within\nthe Vaikhari-vaak exists the nature's Kriya-shakti, or power of action. Vaikhari-vak\nis the grossest level of speech, and it is heard through the external senses.\nWhen sound comes out through the mouth as spoken syllables it is called as\nvaikhari.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">Vaikhari the articulated speech, which, in a\nwaveform, reaches the ears and to the intellect of the listener.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jgjGjUtRxUg/U1_owveAMgI/AAAAAAAArzM/aMCQcKl29RA/s1600/179ttt1603.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"622\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jgjGjUtRxUg/U1_owveAMgI/AAAAAAAArzM/aMCQcKl29RA/s1600/179ttt1603.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Audible vaikhari lies\nwithin the purview of the conscious mind and jagrat (waking-time\nconsciousness). The spoken sound vaikhari is produced by friction or by\nstriking two things against each other. &nbsp;Its\nfrequencies of vibration are conducted within a certain limited range.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>mulam adharam arabhya\ndvistkantam upeyusi<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>udita aneka sahasra\nsurya vahnindu sannibha<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>cakravat punar adharat\nsanta pasyatha madhyama <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>vaikhari sthanam\nasadhya tatrasta sthanavartini<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>varnanam jananim bhutva\nbhogya prasnoumi gouriva<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Seated in the\narea starting from the muladhara to the position of dvistkanta with effulgence\nequal to the rising of millions of suns, fires and moons. Like a wheel from the\nadhara becoming the sounds known as santa, pashyati, madhyama. &nbsp;Reaching the position of vaikhari, there\nsituated in eight places, viz., the throat etc. Being the mother of all sounds\nI bestow enjoyments like a cow.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yatqN3CgaDE/U2BcJIPbHJI/AAAAAAAArzc/Ju4PMNN8Glk/s1600/imagesy4553.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-yatqN3CgaDE/U2BcJIPbHJI/AAAAAAAArzc/Ju4PMNN8Glk/s1600/imagesy4553.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Graphene is pure carbon\nin the form of a very thin, nearly transparent sheet, basically one atom thick\nand is used in military fighter jet applications. It is remarkably strong for\nits very low weight, and it conducts heat and electricity with great\nefficiency. &nbsp;Graphene can self-repair\nholes in its sheets, when exposed to molecules containing carbon, such as\nhydrocarbons. Bombarded with pure carbon atoms, the atoms perfectly align into\nhexagons, completely filling the holes. &nbsp;It has a beehive hexagon construction .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/GCUg4Kx_CjY/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/GCUg4Kx_CjY&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/GCUg4Kx_CjY&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This primordial word is\nthe AUM. &nbsp;It is every thing&nbsp; -&nbsp; <b>Mandukyopanishad- 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Below:</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Panini got up from a\ndeep trance, wrote the Maheshwara Sutras and formed the Sanskrit grammar.</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-41PDJUA2m6I/U2Brwl0JOcI/AAAAAAAAr0A/bO2jY7NA_qA/s1600/imageffhs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 14 verses are\nknown as \"Maheshwara Sutras\" or \"Maheshwara Sutrani\" (in\nSanskrit). These verses are just a collection of sounds and if you say them\naloud, in one breath, they really sound like drum beats. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PPEsiW4YBlc/U2BoyhJUE0I/AAAAAAAArzs/BM6-JkobZ90/s1600/imageKKHFD.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"210\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-PPEsiW4YBlc/U2BoyhJUE0I/AAAAAAAArzs/BM6-JkobZ90/s1600/imageKKHFD.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And because they emerged from a Divine source,\nthey were so perfect...so complete that Panini was able to create, compile\ncodify the rules of Sanskrit grammar in such a way and till today they have\nremained unchanged.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xlc5-tmpeYA/U2BrdwIz16I/AAAAAAAArz4/MYt3FStc5PQ/s1600/dowddfgnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Xlc5-tmpeYA/U2BrdwIz16I/AAAAAAAArz4/MYt3FStc5PQ/s1600/dowddfgnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiv sutras originated\nfrom Shiva's Tandava dance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot;
