, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">( N\u1e5aatt\u0101vas\u0101ne na\u1e6dar\u0101jar\u0101jo\nnan\u0101da \u1e0dhakk\u0101 navapa\u00f1cav\u0101ram. Uddharttuk\u0101ma\u1e25 sanak\u0101disiddh\u0101din\u0113tadvimar\u015be\n\u015bivas\u016btraj\u0101lam.)<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the end of His\nCosmic Dance,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva, the Lord of\nDance,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">with a view to bless\nthe sages Sanaka and so on,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">played on His Damaru\nfourteen times,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">from which emerged the\nfollowing fourteen Sutras,</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">popularly known as\nShiva Sutras or Maheshwara Sutras.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8jTtmwKWbZ8/U2BtRU4tZWI/AAAAAAAAr0M/IOk2A5PZD3E/s1600/imadeeges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"170\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8jTtmwKWbZ8/U2BtRU4tZWI/AAAAAAAAr0M/IOk2A5PZD3E/s1600/imadeeges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nnR^tta = dance<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\navasAna = end<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nnaTarAja rAjaH = Lord of dance<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nnanAda = sounded<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nDakkAm = damaru<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nnava pancha = nine and five = fourteen<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nvAram = times<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nkAma = for the sake of / with the desire to<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nuddhartu = upliftment<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nsanakAdi = sanaka etc<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nsiddhAn = sages<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\netat = this<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\njAlam = web (of)<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Does it sound like\nbulls#it of the first order?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOPE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a most intelligent\nrearrangement of the alphabet. &nbsp;The\nletter at the end of each sutra is called an it. &nbsp;A letter followed by an it specifies all the\nletters in between. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Mantra is a carrier wave with potent\ninformation within it. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantras must\nbegin and end with OM which resonates with the earths heartbeat of 7.83 hertz. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our\n7000 year old Vedas say, that all forms of reality are sound forms\u2014music\u2014their\nvery substance composed of vibration. This Shabda-brahman is the great cosmic\nwavelength experienced as God.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maharishis realized\nBrahman, or \u201ctranscendental consciousness,\u201d in the form of sound. They knew\nthat this transcendental sound, which has no limits and is immeasurable,\nmanifests not only within the vital air known as prana, but also through our\nsenses and even our mind. We all know that&nbsp;\nsound is the vehicle for emotion, which we can either reinforce or\nrelease. We sing with joy, shout in anger, cry in sorrow and groan in pain.\nThus each emotion corresponds to a particular kind of sound, and intensified\nemotions usually demand stronger sounds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During japa, the whole\nbody vibrates and all other sensations go numb. It\u2019s a beautiful, sensuous\nfeeling that purifies and elevates your entire being to a higher level.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/AKFVEINKuQA/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/AKFVEINKuQA&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/AKFVEINKuQA&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Japa involves the\nmeditative repetition of a mantra. Mantra is mystical energy encapsulated\nwithin a sound structure. Every mantra contains in its vibrations a certain\npower.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/RFq8Nly0qyE/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RFq8Nly0qyE&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/RFq8Nly0qyE&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vachika japa: the\nmantra is repeated out loud<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Upamsu japa: the mantra\nis repeated semi-audibly by moving only the tongue and lips<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Manasa japa: the mantra\nis repeated mentally without allowing the tongue and lips to move<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Likhita japa: the\nmantra is written continuously or for a fixed number of times<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Akhanda japa: the\nmantra is repeated for a specific number of times without a break, or for a\nfixed period of time, such as from sunrise to sunset. Akhanda japa is often\nperformed rhythmically and congregationally.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Alapa japa: the mantra\nis repeated mentally at all times and with every breath.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali speaks of 14\nkinds of japa: &nbsp; &nbsp;daily (nitya), circumstantial (naimittika), the japa of desired\nresults (kamya), forbidden (nishiddha), penitential (prayashchitta), unmoving\n(achala), moving (chala), voiced (vachika), whispered (upanshu), murmured\n(bhramara), mental (manasa), uninterrupted (akhanda), nonuttered (ajapa) and\ncircumambulatory (pradakshina).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6u2ejnnJJm0/U2B_5Na0euI/AAAAAAAAr1A/3bqbZKom2fc/s1600/chanting-gfrjapa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"212\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6u2ejnnJJm0/U2B_5Na0euI/AAAAAAAAr1A/3bqbZKom2fc/s1600/chanting-gfrjapa.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Above</b> : &nbsp;The mala is placed over\nthe middle finger and flicked by the thumb. &nbsp;The index finger is not used, as it represents\nthe ego, which must be transcended to achieve self-realisation. &nbsp;&nbsp;The\nmala retains some of the energy of the mantra, and hence the same mala is used\nfor a mantra.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hold the mala with your\nright hand, resting beads on your middle finger. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The count begins from the first bead that is\nnext to the big dividing bead. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dividing\nbid should never get passed. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As you\nchant, rotate beads between middle finger and a thumb. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Go from one bead to the next as you repeat the\nmantra, a bead per mantra. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you did\none circle of 108 bids, it means you said the mantra 108 times. Turn the mala\naround and begin from the bead you have just finished with. Do not use dividing\nbid for chanting</span></span></i><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantum Physics tells\nus today that every state of matter has its own associated vibration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4000 years ago, Adi\nShankaracharya commented on the Brahma Sutras.&nbsp;\n\u201cThe sound created by the explosion of the primordial atom gave rise to\nthe causal, subtle and gross forms of the universe.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda-Brahman is a\nvibratory reality, which exists underlying the reality which we can perceive. According\nto Vedic theory, this pure vibrational current, flows eternally \u2013 a kind of\nriver of sublime truths \u2013 that can be accessed by anyone who has the ability to\npenetrate within it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In case of each Tantric\nmantra, the practitioner needs to know its rishi (seer), devata (deific power),\nchanndas (rhythm), svara (accentuation), prayogya (application), beej (seed\npower), shakti (a fraction of itself that expresses its power), kavacha\n(armour), kilaka (recitation of which prevents the mantra\u2019s power from moving\naway from the practitioner) and nyasa (the process by which various sounds in\nthe mantra are identified with the energy in particular limbs).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyasa involves touching\nvarious parts of the body while saying specific portions of a mantra. This\ninvokes the &nbsp;presence of the deity of the\nmantra inside the body. Each mantra is associated with a specific Nyasa. There\nare various types of Nyasas, the most important of them being Kara Nyasa and\nAnga Nyasa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/jJWFenO_-G0/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/jJWFenO_-G0&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/jJWFenO_-G0&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No cosmic sound can be\nheard by man\u2019s naked ears. &nbsp;Scientists\nhave found that the sound emanating from planets is pitched twenty octaves\nbelow man\u2019s hearing, while the song of the atom is sung a complementary twenty\noctaves above it, leaving us \u201cmusically midway\u201d between the trebles and basses\nof the micro and macro-cosmic worlds. &nbsp;The\nfunction of a mantra is to create vibrations in the inner consciousness, that\nwill prepare for realization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Being indifferent\ntowards all objects, he who has controlled his passions should continuously\nconcentrate upon the sound which dissolves the mind.\u2026the sound proceeding from\nPranava (OM) which is BrahmAn itsel</span></i>f<b>-&nbsp;&nbsp; Nadabindu Upanishad 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The spiritual efficacy\nof OM is based not on the gross sound, but on the subtle sound, which is heard,\nnot by the ears but by the heart, which is uttered not by the mouth but by the\nmind.&nbsp; OM is the quintessence, the\nseed-syllable (bija mantra) of the universe, the universal force of the\nall-embracing consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MSjxggfB3bo/U2CmS4Rw3cI/AAAAAAAAr1o/6x7YEX2mwyg/s1600/imagdeees.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"384\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MSjxggfB3bo/U2CmS4Rw3cI/AAAAAAAAr1o/6x7YEX2mwyg/s1600/imagdeees.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inner ear ( cochlea\n) gives the cycloid spiral space curve motion. It is the brain and central\nnervous system that hears.&nbsp; The inner ear\nis filled with liquid. Microscopic hairs called cilia project out into this\nliquid and they release a chemical neurotransmitter when stimulated. ( just\nlike the cats's whiskers ).</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BNyo8PP4MHU/U2ClxElrwqI/AAAAAAAAr1Q/DmxlyHBVmlM/s1600/dowcvgnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"312\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BNyo8PP4MHU/U2ClxElrwqI/AAAAAAAAr1Q/DmxlyHBVmlM/s1600/dowcvgnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound waves are transformed into\nnerve impulses, to the temporal lobe of the cerebral cortex which is dedicated\nto sound.&nbsp; The audio range is 20 hz to\n20000 Hz.&nbsp; 1 hertz is one cycle per\nsecond. All musicians convey the message in the 0.5- 4 KHz range .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BQj02TyCKTg/U2CmCD6TndI/AAAAAAAAr1g/seiNy2Qo5Y0/s1600/ima+fges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"340\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BQj02TyCKTg/U2CmCD6TndI/AAAAAAAAr1g/seiNy2Qo5Y0/s1600/ima+fges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A sound wave\nis a longitudinal wave--a series of compressions and rarefactions.. Higher the\nfrequency, higher the perceived pitch.&nbsp;\nThe wonder of the cilia hairs is that it can perceive 1500 levels of\npitch.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zUJi1hB_A5U/U2Cl27ohIEI/AAAAAAAAr1Y/BWnNnIblwKI/s1600/dowcfffnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"271\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zUJi1hB_A5U/U2Cl27ohIEI/AAAAAAAAr1Y/BWnNnIblwKI/s1600/dowcfffnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The number of discriminable tones in in the hundreds of thousands.&nbsp; Are you not able to recognise the voice of a\nlong lost friend?&nbsp;&nbsp; Amazing , right? If\n300 Hz is played in one ear and 310 in the other ear via stereo headphones the\nbinaural frequency will be 10 Hz. Frequencies of the brain are below 40 hertz.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zPjpH7SujCY/U2Cmc6X9MkI/AAAAAAAAr1w/rlQQIXqIeCY/s1600/imssssages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zPjpH7SujCY/U2Cmc6X9MkI/AAAAAAAAr1w/rlQQIXqIeCY/s1600/imssssages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThat indestructible transcendent vibrating\nsound is Shabda-Brahman.\u201d--</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> <b>Shiksha Upanishad 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Letters in Sanskrit are\ncalled akshara, the eternal; they are sound symbols of the eternal reality. The\nfunction of a mantra in Sanskrit is to create vibrations in the inner\nconsciousness. The Vedanta-sutras add that ultimate liberation comes from sound\n(anavrittih shabdat). &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 11 ways of reciting\nthe Vedas- &nbsp;Samhita, Pada, Krama, Jata,\nMaalaa, Sikha, Rekha, Dhwaja, Danda, Rathaa and Ghana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">nama-rupatmanosh\nshabda-<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">bhavayor\navalambanat<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">yo\nyogah sadhyate so'yam<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mantra-yogah\nprakirttitah<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The yoga which is\npracticed through the support of a proper mood (bhava) and sound (shabda), and\nthrough the support of the Self composed of name and form (nama-rupa) is called\nmantra-yoga.\"- <b>Mantra-yoga-samhita\n(3.4)<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra-yoga is one of\nthe most important paths within traditional yoga, and concerns the different\nexpressions of sound, from the most subtle to the coarsest. It is with good\nreason that the Vayaviya Samhita of the Shiva-purana, in describing the five\nclasses of yoga, places mantra yoga first. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Y7OhibdegZY/U2CrO05LdBI/AAAAAAAAr2U/EZubJMQGD1c/s1600/brain+waves+alpwwwha+theta.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"296\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Y7OhibdegZY/U2CrO05LdBI/AAAAAAAAr2U/EZubJMQGD1c/s1600/brain+waves+alpwwwha+theta.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This authoritative path\ncounts on the support of the Vedic scriptures. We may refer to a wide range of\nancient texts that expound in detail on this path, among which some are:\nMantra-mahodadhi, Mantra-muktavali, Mantra-yoga-samhita, Mantra-kaumudi, Mantra-maharnava\nand Tattvananda-tara\u00e1<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anavrittih shabdad\nanavrittih shabdat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Through\nsound we cease to return to a body, or we liberate ourselves.\"</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n-- <b>Vedanta-sutra &nbsp;(4.4.23)</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zZ87OUsbkSw/U2CrCnMiMzI/AAAAAAAAr2M/izyUC0tFArs/s1600/Brainwavedd.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"237\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zZ87OUsbkSw/U2CrCnMiMzI/AAAAAAAAr2M/izyUC0tFArs/s1600/Brainwavedd.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscious repetition of\nmantras liberates the energy that lies within them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two oscillators\npulsating in the same field in almost identical rhythm will tend to \"lock\nin,\" with the result that eventually their vibrations will become\nprecisely synchronous. This phenomenon is referred to as \"mutual\nphase-locking\" or \"entrainment.\" <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BwQQcP5H2dI/U2Cq82NF5qI/AAAAAAAAr2E/_aAO3fHECm0/s1600/brainwave_eneeetrainment.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"221\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BwQQcP5H2dI/U2Cq82NF5qI/AAAAAAAAr2E/_aAO3fHECm0/s1600/brainwave_eneeetrainment.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Entrainment is\nuniversal in nature. In fact, it is so ubiquitous that we hardly notice it,\n\"as with the air we breathe,\" The tendency of the universe to share\nrhythms, that is, to vibrate in harmony.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In cancer cases we\nobserve a total irregularity of all rhythms. Apparently the cancer cell causes\na withdrawal from the temporal harmony of the body functions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o1AqssL8CBA/U2Cq3mImOMI/AAAAAAAAr18/zy8e-6-xFVk/s1600/3531104_f26ddd0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o1AqssL8CBA/U2Cq3mImOMI/AAAAAAAAr18/zy8e-6-xFVk/s1600/3531104_f26ddd0.jpg\" width=\"390\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dve brahmani veditavye\nsabda bramha param ca yat <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sabda bramhani nisnatah\nparam bramhadhi gacchati<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<i style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThere\nare two Bramhans to be realized, Shabda and Param Bramhan: one who has realized\nand well versed in Shabda Bramhan will realize Param BramhAn.\u201d</span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n&nbsp;&nbsp;:-<b>Amrta\nBindu Upanisad- 5000 BC</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra is part of a\nuniversal language rooted in sound, image, number and symbol, reflecting a\n\"cosmic thinking\" beyond the preconceptions and biases of human\nthought. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b0IBn3QatJA/U2DP8BwUAKI/AAAAAAAAr5A/ZUEPpogpAE8/s1600/scalar-wavyyes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b0IBn3QatJA/U2DP8BwUAKI/AAAAAAAAr5A/ZUEPpogpAE8/s1600/scalar-wavyyes.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra functions\naccording to the inner mathematics of cosmic law. &nbsp;It serves to link our\nindividual intelligence with the greater intelligence that pervades all space,\nextending our awareness into the Infinite and Eternal. &nbsp;To chant a mantra at a\ndeeper yogic level is to think with the entire universe and to access the\nwisdom and experience of all beings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra in the yogic\nsense relates to the prime energies, ideas, principles or archetypes of the\ncosmic intelligence that directs the forces of nature and the movements of our\nown minds and hearts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are mantric\nsounds that can awaken the higher potentials of the brain and change the flow\nof energy in the nervous system. &nbsp;Each one of us has a unique sound pattern that\nsustains all that we do and allows our energies to move and grow or stagnate\nand decline. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unless we learn to\nharmonize our inner sound vibrations, our lives will likely remain in\ndisharmony and suffering. &nbsp;Mantra is the most important tool for attuning our\nbodies and minds to their proper resonance, which is not with the outer world,\nbut with the divine presence that constitutes our own deepest Self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra maintains the\nstrength and integrity of our mental field, so that the mind no longer wanders\noff or loses its composure. &nbsp;Mantra sustains the proper circulation of energies\nin the sphere of the mind, so that we are no longer vulnerable to external conditioning\nwhich, after all, is based largely on reactive patterns of words and names.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as Yoga asanas\nplace the body in a calm and relaxed state, so mantras puts the mind into a\nsteady and relaxed state for meditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra practice\ngradually calms and integrates the mind. &nbsp;The mind becomes silent, concentrated and\nreflective, allowing our awareness to vibrate with the mantra. &nbsp;This naturally leads to deeper meditation, in\nwhich the mantra may fall away. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Formless meditation is\nhard to achieve directly but becomes easily accessible once one builds the\npower of mantra in the mind. When we repeat a mantra, or do various forms of\nchanting, a more refined vibration develops and begins to assume the background\npattern of our mind, down to a subconscious level. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we continually\nreturn to the mantra each time our mind becomes agitated, then the mantra's\npower to calm the mind will increase. &nbsp;With\nthe mantra, we have a tool for redirecting the energy of the mind within so\nthat we can reclaim our inner composure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Hatha Yoga was\nfirst propagated in North America, &nbsp;there\nwas a lot of prejudice against all things PAGAN Hinduism. &nbsp;&nbsp;So,\nnaturally, the critical mantra got left out of Hatha practice. &nbsp;Mainstream America and the environments\u2014the\nYMCAs, gyms, adult education classes\u2014in which Yoga classes were held, were not\nconducive to holding the Indian culture. &nbsp;They wanted to eat the food , but left out the\namazing flavour .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Japa is not a mere mechanical\nactivity, but a very intense activity with profound concentration. It can be a\nbit hard to start with, but with practice it becomes easier and more natural. Repeat\nthe mantra softly with concentration so as to lead the mind to pass beyond\neverything that is connected with the domain of thought. &nbsp;Try to\nreach the spiritual domain where even thought is not allowed to enter. &nbsp;The mind must be perfectly calm, as though it\nno longer existed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tradition of\nrepeating the mantra existed in the Patanjali school of yoga, they call its swadhyaya,\nnot japa. &nbsp;It begins as an ordinary\nsound, later it becomes in you the power of the mantra, it transforms you. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Japa can be practiced\nunder any conditions: when one is walking, standing or sitting, giving or\nreceiving, lying down or doing any of the things we do in everyday life,\nwhatever the situation in which you find yourself. &nbsp;There is no restriction, rule or limit. &nbsp;When one repeats japa with faith and respect,\none certainly arrives at a happy state<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effect of the\nmantra is not produced at the level of reason. The knowledge acquired by the\nrepetition of the mantra extends far beyond the level of reason. In India we say\nthat it is in the depths of consciousness. A big chunk of the Vedas are mantras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit is called the\nlanguage of nature because it maintains a correlation between sound and form\ncalled namarupa. &nbsp;This means that the\nsound of the word matches the thing it is describing. The alphabets could be\nseen by the seers in their minds when it was uttered. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit\u2019s resonant\nfrequencies match the energy centres (chakras) in the subtle body and the\nsounds stimulate, activate, energize and open them.&nbsp; This increases the flow of life force (prana)\nin your mind and body resulting in improved health, strength and heightened\nawareness. &nbsp;This shows that Sanskrit is a\ndivine language .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2hJpwAdu2uI/U2DOfKhhhbI/AAAAAAAAr4Q/ubcQB9rrrtA/s1600/imiiiages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2hJpwAdu2uI/U2DOfKhhhbI/AAAAAAAAr4Q/ubcQB9rrrtA/s1600/imiiiages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cochlea in the\ninner ear and it has a spiral shape and has three and half coils . &nbsp;Kundalini like cochlea is coiled and rests at\nthe base of the backbone. &nbsp;Kundalini has\nthree and half coils too. If cochlea contains nerves that connects sound\nvibrations with the nervous system that generates consciousness-- Kundalini &nbsp;is the&nbsp;\nsubtlest of vibrations that generate consciousness in human self. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada Yoga talks about\ndifferent postures to hear the inner sound by closing the ears with thumbs. The\nhearing&nbsp; of inner sound has direct\ncorrelation with the rising of esoteric&nbsp;\nKundalini in human bodies that&nbsp;\nopens the floodgate of universal consciousness in individual bodies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brain scans of have\nbeen taken of participants were compared while in a resting state and during\nthe chanting of japa or kirtans.&nbsp; The\nstudy revealed that there was a marked increase in brain activity in areas of\nthe brain that control memory.&nbsp; One\nparticularly significant finding was that the increase in brain activity occurs\nin the first part of the brain to experience a functional decrease in\nAlzheimer\u2019s patients.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The state of health,\naccording to Yoga Psychology, is the balanced flow of energy (Prana) through\nall the energy circuits of the mind and body. &nbsp;When this flow gets interrupted, by\ninterfering with or breaking some laws of Nature, the body begins to revolt. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This revolt is seen and\nexperienced in the form of different symptoms, discomfort and dis-ease. &nbsp;&nbsp;Ancient\nIndians knew how to reestablish the lost harmony and rhythm of the body and\nmind by utilizing Shabda BrahmAn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra healing is an\nautomatic process of deep inner healing set in motion through the right\ncombinations of sounds that resonate within and fill the space around us.&nbsp; Since we are a product of our immediate\nenvironment, Nada Yoga music aims to treat the environment first, with music based\non the chemistry of sound from the ancient sacred music of India.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xWHxp53x_Wk/U2DOxWcDMJI/AAAAAAAAr4Y/YFeDz6ucyoQ/s1600/constructive_d99estructive_wave.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xWHxp53x_Wk/U2DOxWcDMJI/AAAAAAAAr4Y/YFeDz6ucyoQ/s1600/constructive_d99estructive_wave.gif\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey, yank hilly\nbillys-- mantra is a catalyst for mystical states. &nbsp;&nbsp;Mantras are access codes into states of Yoga.\n&nbsp;The ancient Indian scalar interferometry\nmissiles and vimanas has mantra passwords.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;Scalar waves are very different\nfrom electromagnetic waves. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first world war was fought on IDIOT Isaac Newtons\u2019s\nlaw of inertia of classical physics states that inertia is the product of mass\nand acceleration, F= m * a.&nbsp; &nbsp;He got it\nwrong.&nbsp; Inertia is simply the resistance,\nthe drag that objects experience when accelerated in the zero point field.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>where N is the Avogadro\nconstant number of 6.0221367 \u00d7 1023&nbsp;\n,&nbsp;&nbsp; h is Planck\u2019s constant of\n6.626 \u00d7 10-34 joule-seconds, c is the velocity of light in vacuum of\n299,792,458 m/sec , and f is the frequency of vibration depending on the mass\nof the molecule, (which is different&nbsp; for\ndifferent isotopes of the same element.).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-guwXmVG97No/U2LeUb1z5lI/AAAAAAAAr9o/67K-QzNFMGU/s1600/imagfffes+(9).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Dantikoti sahasreshu\nashwamedha shatakratau<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
