margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1MJ5VsCdmCA/U0EWvyqN2VI/AAAAAAAArGw/XTemv4jAjy4/s1600/DarcysLai76iw.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In hard rock areas, however, flow of water through fracture\nzones does not follow Darcy\u2019s law as the flow is similar to the flow through an\nopen pipe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-sZEEVQKmDAo/U0EVzZZlF6I/AAAAAAAArGo/6sO4DA5K49E/s1600/hydddero1.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"373\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-sZEEVQKmDAo/U0EVzZZlF6I/AAAAAAAArGo/6sO4DA5K49E/s1600/hydddero1.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On chemical tankers we\nuse Darcy\u2019s law for the toxic/ carcinogenic vapor return system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>VAPOR RETURN SYSTEM\nCHEMICAL TANKERS VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">In India if we ask a\nwater expert about Darcy\u2019s law , he will probably scratch his head. &nbsp;We need more perceptive people in the water\nresources dept ( with better&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">salaries</span></span></b><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;) than in electronics and computer engineering.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hy4H0sx2Y0Y/U0EXJlLPmSI/AAAAAAAArG4/xX9qXIKE__A/s1600/aquifer_tutypes.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"260\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hy4H0sx2Y0Y/U0EXJlLPmSI/AAAAAAAArG4/xX9qXIKE__A/s1600/aquifer_tutypes.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hilly regions are known\nto have poor groundwater storage. This happens because water from rainfall and\nother surface water bodies that seep underground tend to flow out when exposed\nto steep mountain sides. In hilly regions, it is quite a common sight to find\nthat water is seeping or spurting out as a spring from along an exposed side of\na hill.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BCebpxROib0/U0EX1MArAJI/AAAAAAAArHE/5rVXEzKlffE/s1600/saturated_zobtene.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"516\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BCebpxROib0/U0EX1MArAJI/AAAAAAAArHE/5rVXEzKlffE/s1600/saturated_zobtene.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes we find small\ndug wells at the top of a hill temple that contains water round the year and\npeople get impressed.&nbsp; This well at the\nhill top eventually receives groundwater recharge through fractures or delayed\nseepage from a recharge area located at an even higher elevation in some out of\nsight adjoining hills.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Besides, in most\ncases, such wells do not get dry as only very little quantity of water is\nextracted for regular use.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is NO miracle in this-- for water finds its universal level..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Vkm2KRqoRcU/U0EZGP475RI/AAAAAAAArHQ/SFXElHFW2Ts/s1600/downlhthboad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"187\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Vkm2KRqoRcU/U0EZGP475RI/AAAAAAAArHQ/SFXElHFW2Ts/s1600/downlhthboad.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nYou may wonder <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">why\na place like Rajasthan despite having such thick layers of sand formations is\nstill poor in groundwater occurrence. The reason being that the recharge\nreceived from rainfall by these thick sand formations is never adequate to\nbuild up a water table. The entire infiltration gets disseminated and lost\nwithin the unsaturated zone before reaching an impervious layer at depth for\nbuilding up a water table.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Occurrence and\ndistribution of groundwater is controlled primarily by the geology of the area\nand the quantum of recharge received by the existing aquifer formations. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The alluvial tracts of river valleys and the coastal plains containing\nalternative deposits of sand and clay of varying thickness are rich in\ngroundwater. Regions underlain by hard rocks are poor in groundwater resources.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vRZijKkErtI/U0EZ3eHR1qI/AAAAAAAArHY/oqcf6lgzQMI/s1600/imaggrees.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"246\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vRZijKkErtI/U0EZ3eHR1qI/AAAAAAAArHY/oqcf6lgzQMI/s1600/imaggrees.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The groundwater table undergoes a\nseasonal fluctuation . The water table rises during rainy\nseason due to recharge received from rainfall and falls back during summer\nseason due to lack of recharge and continuing extraction of groundwater.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\ngeohydrology, the highest water level is referred to as the post-monsoon water\nlevel and the lowest level in summer as pre-monsoon water level.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantum of\nwater being received by an aquifer from annual recharge can be computed from\nthe annual ground water fluctuation in conjunction with estimated groundwater\nextraction in that area. &nbsp;Records and trends must be maintained.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater in an area\nis said to be falling (receding or declining) when annual groundwater\nextraction exceeds the annual groundwater recharge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The excess water extracted\nin such a situation comes from the groundwater dead storage built up over many centuries &nbsp;and hence the over-extraction is known as GROUND WATER MINING.&nbsp; It is a well known fact that such reckless\nmining is going on in India since the past 20 years.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/sH8XmG1Bvz8/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/sH8XmG1Bvz8&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/sH8XmG1Bvz8&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An aquifer is said to\nbe over-exploited when the annual groundwater extraction is higher than the\nannual recharge. &nbsp;For sustainable\nutilization of groundwater, only that much water should be extracted which is\nreplenished every year by rainfall through groundwater recharge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To achieve\nthis, we must either reduce our groundwater extraction (demand side management)\nor increase recharge to the extent possible by adapting artificial recharge\nmeasures (supply side management). &nbsp;Or else,\nthe groundwater table will continue to fall leading to an unprecedented\nsituation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/CvJSGS7MT3w/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/CvJSGS7MT3w&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/CvJSGS7MT3w&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Bentonie clay slurry can be used for an impenetrable bottom and sides in the pit, instead of large plastic sheets.</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/2x23ljyT0S4/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/2x23ljyT0S4&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/2x23ljyT0S4&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://ytimg.googleusercontent.com/vi/YdwKDVzh1cs/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/YdwKDVzh1cs&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"https://youtube.googleapis.com/v/YdwKDVzh1cs&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is important to\nrecharge the coastal aquifers like in Chennai, to prevent salt water ingress. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RAIN WATER HARVESTING IN\nCOASTAL AREAS IS NOT ABOUT STORING YOUR OWN WATER FOR YOUR SELFISH PRIVATE\nNEEDS \u2013&nbsp; BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY TO RECHARGE\nDEPLETED AQUIFERS , TO PREVENT THEM FROM BEING SALT CONTAMINATED FOREVER.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coastal regions are\nrich in groundwater owing to the largely alluvial terrain, but the aquifers\nrisk being contaminated by saltwater ingress due to over pumping.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kC2SqqThgBE/U0FKZuA6jvI/AAAAAAAArHo/pdjPEH3pBeE/s1600/borewell-recfeqharge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kC2SqqThgBE/U0FKZuA6jvI/AAAAAAAArHo/pdjPEH3pBeE/s1600/borewell-recfeqharge.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India, the number of\nshallow tubewells used to draw groundwater was 2000 in 1955, and is now in\nexcess of 30 million.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lowering of water table\nhas rendered millions of existing shallow dug wells in the country go dry. This\nin turn has led to an unhealthy race for deepening the existing dug wells but\nmore so for the construction of deeper and deeper bore wells.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the cost of accessing groundwater has been\nincreasing progressively, in near future groundwater will be accessible only to\nthe very rich, depriving the poorer lot.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An ancient abandoned and\ndry dug well can be used very conveniently as a makeshift artificial recharge\nstructure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Millions of dug wells in the country which at one time were yielding\ngroundwater have gone completely dry as even the post-monsoon water table has\ngone below the depth of such dug wells\u2014losing out in competition to deep borewells..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All that needs to be\ndone is that the abandoned dug well should be clean enough i.e. free from any\ndumping of undesirable materials like plastic and impermeable clay.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gfsWjuy7tno/U0FMl-pUFAI/AAAAAAAArH0/Z0Pdbv1IrTw/s1600/imaggreres.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gfsWjuy7tno/U0FMl-pUFAI/AAAAAAAArH0/Z0Pdbv1IrTw/s1600/imaggreres.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High concentrations of\narsenic sometimes exist in deeper levels of groundwater. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The acceptable level as\ndefined by WHO for maximum concentrations of arsenic in safe drinking water is\n0.01 mg/L. &nbsp;But is is safer if it is &nbsp;less than &nbsp;0.05 mg/L <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arsenic contaminated\nwater can cause major health problems,-- &nbsp;cancer, diseases of the circulatory and\nrespiratory system, diabetes mellitus, and kidney and liver diseases. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Activated alumina is an\nadsorbent that effectively removes arsenic. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zGr5zEsWbbg/U0FQJ586DmI/AAAAAAAArIA/crqupXigl-4/s1600/arsenic-poisoning-mgrtranzur.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zGr5zEsWbbg/U0FQJ586DmI/AAAAAAAArIA/crqupXigl-4/s1600/arsenic-poisoning-mgrtranzur.jpg\" width=\"460\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In subterranean arsenic\nremoval (SAR), aerated groundwater is recharged back into the aquifer to create\nan oxidation zone which can trap iron and arsenic on the soil particles through\nadsorption process. No chemicals are used and almost no sludge is produced\nduring operational stage since iron and arsenic compounds are rendered inactive\nin the aquifer itself.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wDBDUwuMY38/U0FRv11YFjI/AAAAAAAArIM/gSTxmkZel1o/s1600/20087-Slidmhfge1.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wDBDUwuMY38/U0FRv11YFjI/AAAAAAAArIM/gSTxmkZel1o/s1600/20087-Slidmhfge1.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus toxic waste disposal and the risk of its future\nmobilization is prevented. Also, it has very long operational life, similar to\nthe long lasting tube wells drawing water from the shallow aquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water may be physically\nuncontaminated and look safe but it may still be contaminated chemically and\nbacteriologically. Major cations found dissolved in water in appreciable\nquantities are calcium, sodium and magnesium in combination with anions like\nchloride, carbonate and sulphate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other chemical elements found commonly in\ngroundwater in minute quantities that are known to cause serious health hazards\nare iron, fluoride, arsenic, boron, detergents, heavy metals and other site\nspecific contaminants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water is said to have\ntemporary hardness when it contains soluble bi-carbonates of calcium and\nmagnesium. When heated the bicarbonates convert into insoluble carbonates which\nare deposited out of the water, making it soft.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Permanent hardness is formed\ndue to presence of salts of sulphate and chloride in combination with calcium,\nsodium and magnesium. These salts can be removed from water only through\nchemical reactions with other salts referred to as softening reagents or\nthrough the process of reverse osmosis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Total Dissolved Solids\n(TDS). It is the total quantity of chemical salts dissolved in water and is\nmeasured&nbsp; in parts per million (ppm). One\nppm means 1 mg of salt is dissolved in 1000 liters of water. For drinking\npurposes - TDS up to 500 ppm is quite good.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the TDS and pH of\ndrinking water may be well within the permissible limit, but presence of\narsenic, fluoride, iron and any other toxic compounds beyond the permissible\nlimit can make the water harmful to health.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though the water may\nget physically cleaned of physical impurities while percolating through a\nporous media to recharge groundwater,&nbsp;\nthe chemical properties remain more or less the same. In hard rock\nformation, polluted water can directly infiltrate to the groundwater storage\ncarrying the surface contaminants through fractured zones.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soils\nnowadays contain a host of man made pollutants in large quantities. Rain water\ncarries whatever pollutants it has dissolved from soil during its journey\ndownwards. It is imperative that India band plastics. Force these multinational\nsoft drink companies to store soft drinks in glass bottles. If they don\u2019t do\nthat kick them out of India.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many factory owners\npump in their chemical effluents directly into bore holes for disposal, which\nis without a doubt an unpardonable criminal-they should be heavily fined and\nimprisoned. We even know of overflowing septic sewage tank contents ( feces )\nbeing transported by trucks and pumped into abandoned wells at night.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAKE GROUND WATER\nSTUDIES COMPULSORY IN SCHOOL SCIENCE BOOKS. MAIN STREAM MEDIA MUST HAVE\nCOMPULSORY PRIME TIME SHOWS , RATHER THAN DISCUSSING SACHIN TENDULKAR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The control of\ndrinking-water quality is therefore critical in preventing fluorosis. In all\nfluoride affected areas it is advised that rainwater harvesting is done to\nrecharge the groundwater source that shows high fluoride levels.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nalgonda District in\nAndhra Pradesh is said to have the highest concentration of people affected by\nfluorosis. Nearly 500 villages in the district are gripped by fluorosis\nresulting in twenty thousand fluorosis victims in the district. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the World\nHealth Organization, maximum level of fluoride in water should be 1 ppm or 1\nmg/l. In Nalgonda, the water contains up to 10 ppm of fluoride. Many adults and\neven young children have been irreversibly affected by skeletal fluorosis in\nthis district.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ubzEnZFu1mk/U0FcJK1ctPI/AAAAAAAArIk/cUCi_jzdgaM/s1600/SFhtjfd.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ubzEnZFu1mk/U0FcJK1ctPI/AAAAAAAArIk/cUCi_jzdgaM/s1600/SFhtjfd.png\" width=\"189\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High fluoride content\nin water can lead to dental fluorosis, brittle bones and quick ageing.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nIndia an estimated 60 million people have been poisoned by well water\ncontaminated by excessive fluoride, which is dissolved from the granite rocks. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effects are\nparticularly evident in the bone deformations of children.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">exposure\nto \"high\" levels of fluoride (variously defined) in childhood was\nassociated with a reduction in IQ by more than 10 points on the Mensa scale\u2014you\nbecome mandha buddhis.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-pmg8BMUXLdY/U0FcDlAaXYI/AAAAAAAArIc/FV6QNSJTwJs/s1600/Screennoibgshot_2.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-pmg8BMUXLdY/U0FcDlAaXYI/AAAAAAAArIc/FV6QNSJTwJs/s1600/Screennoibgshot_2.png\" width=\"596\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are methods used\nin developing countries that are suitable for either large-scale fluoridation\nplants or for domestic/household use. In some cases it would assist to educate\nresidents to avoid using untreated groundwater for cooking or drinking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In USA they have put fluoride\nin the municipal water and caused a full generation of daft hilly Billys with shriveled\nand calcified pineal glands.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ltH2e-S7-Zc/U0FcQd9gjjI/AAAAAAAArIs/FnuYmPMPliw/s1600/993935_543185149063ugfd51_19865552_n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ltH2e-S7-Zc/U0FcQd9gjjI/AAAAAAAArIs/FnuYmPMPliw/s1600/993935_543185149063ugfd51_19865552_n.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>PINEAL GLAND &nbsp;THE THIRD EYE VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flushing the western\ncommode takes lot of water. &nbsp;In cities\nthe govt must enforce the partial flush option. &nbsp;It is not about HAVE MONEY WILL FLUSH.&nbsp; &nbsp;It is about wasting a national ground water resource. &nbsp;People with diabetes who pee a lot, keep flushing the whole day\u2014 and India is full of diabetics\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water must NOT\nbe wasted. &nbsp;AK49 did NOT understand this\nwisdom, when he reduced the water bills of New Delhi -- so that he could &nbsp;topple the Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18 lakes are now slums\nat Bangalore. &nbsp;8 have been eaten up by\nbuilders in connivance with politicians and municipality. &nbsp;28 lakes have been officially been distributed\nby the Bangalore Development Authority for residential areas.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nCXanM5vw2w/U0J0SGPzxpI/AAAAAAAArKY/bSs-4za_8iw/s1600/fg11_0hvyfy07.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
